events.title: Grand Central Terminal Opens in New York City
events.description: Grand Central Terminal, a landmark railway terminal in New York City, officially opened to the public, becoming a major transportation hub and architectural icon.
events.significance: It revolutionized train travel in the U.S. and remains an important cultural and historical site.

events.title: The Day the Music Died
events.description: A tragic plane crash near Clear Lake, Iowa, killed musicians Buddy Holly, Ritchie Valens, and J.P. "The Big Bopper" Richardson.
events.significance: This event marked a significant loss in the rock and roll era and deeply impacted the music industry.

events.title: Romania Joins NATO's Partnership for Peace Program
events.description: Romania became a member of NATO's Partnership for Peace, a program aimed at building trust and cooperation with former Eastern Bloc countries.
events.significance: This was a key step in Romania's integration into Western political and security structures after the Cold War.

events.title: Preliminary Treaty of Paris Signed
events.description: Great Britain and the United States signed preliminary articles of peace, ending the American Revolutionary War.
events.significance: This treaty laid the groundwork for the formal end of the war and recognition of American independence.
